parallel

Class TimerThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • parallel.TimerThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public final class TimerThread
extends java.lang.Thread
    Utility class, similar (but simpler) to the ones found in concurrent utils. The class is useful if one wishes to poll whether enough time has passed but without forcing busy-waiting kind of polling or query system time calls on their basic thread of computation. See graph.packing.GRASPPacker for an example of use.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2014-2017

    Company:

    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TimerThread(long time)
      constructor specifies the amount of time in milliseconds for which, after this thread has started, the doContinue() method will return true.
      TimerThread(long time, boolean cont)
      same as 1-arg constructor, except if the second argument is false, the doContinue() method will always return false.
      TimerThread(long time, boolean cont, java.lang.Runnable runAfterTimeElapses)
      same as 2-arg constructor, except if the third argument is not-null, the object's run() method will execute in this thread as soon as the specified time interval elapses.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TimerThread

        public TimerThread(long time)
        constructor specifies the amount of time in milliseconds for which, after this thread has started, the doContinue() method will return true. After that interval of time elapses, the thread will exit, and its doContinue() method will return false.
        Parameters:
        time - long (representing milliseconds)

      • TimerThread

        public TimerThread(long time,
                   boolean cont)
        same as 1-arg constructor, except if the second argument is false, the doContinue() method will always return false.
        Parameters:
        time -
        cont -

      • TimerThread

        public TimerThread(long time,
                   boolean cont,
                   java.lang.Runnable runAfterTimeElapses)
        same as 2-arg constructor, except if the third argument is not-null, the object's run() method will execute in this thread as soon as the specified time interval elapses.
        Parameters:
        time - long // ms
        cont - boolean
        runAfterTimeElapses - Runnable
